intro: Amauropelta caucaensis, commonly known as the Cauca shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of Colombia and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in montane forests. Its leaves are usually leathery and have a rugged texture, with a deep green color. Amauropelta caucaensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
